title: Virgil van Dijk: Southampton star to miss EFL Cup final against Manchester United with serious ankle injury
text:
Wembley Woe Virgil van Dijk: Southampton star to miss EFL Cup final against Manchester United with serious ankle injury 
Dutch defender has been ruled out for three months and leave Saints with a defensive crisis following sale of Jose Fonte By ANTHONY CHAPMAN Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments SOUTHAMPTON defender Virgil van Dijk will miss the League Cup final against Manchester United after being ruled out for three months with an ankle injury. 
Van Dijk suffered the problem in Southampton’s win over Leicester on January 22 and the Dutch centre-back won’t return to action until late in the season. Reuters 3 Virgil van Dijk will miss the EFL Cup final against Man Utd with an ankle injury 
That rules him out of Southampton’s first League Cup appearance since 1979 as they bid to win the competition for the first time by beating United at Wembley on February 26. Keep up to date with ALL the Southampton news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
“He will not be available for many weeks, two or three months,” Southampton manager Claude Puel said on Thursday. 
“It’s an important problem and difficult for us. He is important for the group and the fans with his quality and leadership. Southampton fans celebrate goal that cements a trip to Wembley after beating Liverpool PA:Press Association Southampton are looking light at the back after also selling Jose Fonte to West Ham Related Stories Twitter goes into meltdown as Southampton sign 'Sergio Ramos' on deadline day tv times What TV channel is Southampton vs West Ham on and how can I watch it? gift of the gab Southampton sign Napoli striker and Italian international Manolo Gabbiadini NOT FOR KEEPS Southampton sign talented young stopper Mouez Hassen on loan to provide back-up to Fraser Forster Reuters 3 Claude Puel claims Ryan Bertrand could deputise for Van Dijk in the centre 
"It's a blow but we will find a solution. For the semi-final second leg against Liverpool we got a fantastic result without him and we will continue with other possibilities. 
"Ryan Bertrand can play in this position, and we will see with young players like Jack Stephens. We have possibilities."
